title: [REQUEST] Autocompletion support in prompt, as seen in prompt_toolkit
body:
**How would you improve Rich?**

Your library is already awesome and I am terribly sorry to appear to you as an insatiable guy, but there is a very nice feature in the library `prompt_toolkit` ( https://github.com/prompt-toolkit/python-prompt-toolkit ) that I think would be fantastic to have in rich as well.

And that is **Autocompletion**.
prompt_toolkit does it through the use of a class named WordCompleter (see for reference: https://python-prompt-toolkit.readthedocs.io/en/master/pages/asking_for_input.html#autocompletion )


IMHO it would be great if a user could write something like this:

````python
from rich.prompt import Prompt

names = ["Paul", "Jessica", "Duncan"]
name = Prompt.ask("Enter your name", default="Paul", completer=names)
print("You said: %s" % name)
````

And have rich showing a pop-up dialog where you can choose one of the allowed names, as shown in this mock-up image:

![Schermata 2020-10-18 alle 15 20 15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/605017/96368720-c92d1780-1155-11eb-83e6-b56f3fee66bd.png)


If you think it could be an interesting feature, please consider this request for a future update.
Thank you :-)
